definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: February was definitely not a good month for the automobile industry in America.
sentences.chinese: 二月份铁定是美国汽车工业销售惨淡的一个月。

sentences.english: LeBron James is a lock to start his fifth consecutive All-Star team.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯是铁定开始他连续第五次全明星首发阵容的。

sentences.english: Japan's economy seems doomed to fall back into recession.
sentences.chinese: 日本经济看来也铁定要跌回到不景气。

sentences.english: My mom is dead set on me going to graduate school, I guess Imust go.
sentences.chinese: 我是铁定了心要我上研究生，我猜我必需的去了。

sentences.english: Such a person's results must be eliminated.
sentences.chinese: 这样的人的结果铁定是被淘汰。

sentences.english: The United States will keep its "ironclad" commitment to allies in the region, he added.
sentences.chinese: 美国将继续对该地区的盟友保持“铁定的”承诺。

sentences.english: China’s economy certainly can not depend on exports over the next year.
sentences.chinese: 中国经济铁定不能指望靠出口过个好年。

definition: most likely/mostly (in 8 or 9 cases out of 10)/vast majority
hard to say/can't guarantee/difficult to protect/difficult to preserve
everything bodes ill, no positive signs (idiom); inauspicious/everything points to disaster
more likely than not/quite possible/on the cards
it'd be a wonder if... (following a verb phrase that is usually negative)
